page.title: 06Occupations in Mickleton
page.content: According to 'The Story of Our Village 1850-1957',compiled by the Women's Institute,{agriculture}in that period was in decline and{market gardening} was soon the greatest employer. Gradually this has decreased and much of the land has been sold for house building.So more people travel further to their work.Many men are employed at the{Royal Engineer Depot}at Long Marston,within cycling distance,but most use their cars.Others travel to Birmingham,Coventry,Leamington, Stratford-on-Avon and Cheltenham. The{Threeways Hotel}and the two Public Houses,{The Butchers Arms and The {Kings Arms},employ local part-time staff.J Seyfried (veg.brining plant), one of three grocers shops,one a P.O., and the butchers shop (once the old forge)employ part-time staff.
